required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Management of Eyelid Disorders by Ophthalmologists in Usual Medical Practice

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the incidence and characteristics of eyelid inflammatory disorders during general ophthalmological consultations and to demonstrate association between palpebral pathologies and ocular surface pathologies.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of eyelid disorders in general ophthalmological practice
primary_outcome.description: Systematic description of the eyelid, the ocular surface and the dermatological aspect of the face Occurrence of Meibomian Gland Dysfunction(MGD).

secondary_outcome.measure: Association between palpebral pathologies and ocular surface pathologies
secondary_outcome.description: To describe association between palpebral pathologies and ocular surface pathologies

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of eyelid disorder on patient's daily life
secondary_outcome.description: Consequences on vision, on daily life activities/work, on leisure, on contact lens wearing, on emotions, on sleeping,

secondary_outcome.measure: Current recommended strategy to treat eyelids disorders

arm_group.description: Outpatients of either sex, aged at least 18 years, seen in general ophthalmological consultation Patients informed of the objectives of the survey and agreeing to participate. Patient attending to the ophthalmological consultation for any reasons: regular check-up of chronic disease, acute symptoms, or for surgery preparation or follow up.

study_pop.textblock:
Patients will be eligible for inclusion if all these criteria are respected:
- Outpatients of either sex, aged at least 18 years, seen in general ophthalmological consultation
- Patients informed of the objectives of the survey and agreeing to participate.
- Patient attending to the ophthalmological consultation for any reasons: regular check-up of chronic disease, acute symptoms, or for surgery preparation or follow up.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Outpatients of either sex, aged at least 18 years, seen in general ophthalmological consultation
- Patients informed of the objectives of the survey and agreeing to participate.
- Patient attending to the ophthalmological consultation for any reasons: regular check-up of chronic disease, acute symptoms, or for surgery preparation or follow up.

overall_official.last_name: José Manuel Benitez del Castillo, Professor
overall_official.affiliation: USIO, Departamento de Oftalmología, Hospital Clínico San Carlos, 28040 Madrid, Spain

facility.name: USIO Departamento de Oftalmologia Hospital Clínico San Carlos
